event.title: thousands of years indigenous peoples had lived

data.event: For thousands of years indigenous peoples had lived along the rivers in this area, with varying cultures.

event.title: 1541 the Spanish explorer Hernando de Soto and expedition passed

data.event: In 1541 the Spanish explorer Hernando de Soto and expedition passed through the area, as did the 1721 expedition of Bernard de la Harpe.

event.title: 1796 Jean Pierre Chouteau, a French trader from St. Louis, established

data.event: In 1796 Jean Pierre Chouteau, a French trader from St. Louis, established the first trading post in 1796 at the junction of the Grand/Neosho River and Saline Creek for business with the Osage.

event.title: included Salina with the Louisiana Purchase in 1803

data.event: The United States took possession of the land that included Salina with the Louisiana Purchase in 1803.
